item.title: Renault to Make Drones in Ukraine, France Info Reports
item.description: French automaker Renault SA will produce drones in Ukraine, according to France Info.
item.dc:creator: Ania Nussbaum

media:content.media:description: A badge on a vehicle displayed on the Renault SA stand on day two of the Geneva International Motor Show in Geneva, Switzerland, on Tuesday, Feb. 27, 2024. The show runs until Sunday, March 3.

item.title: US Seeks Deal in London on China Rare Earth Flows, Hassett Says
item.description: US negotiators will aim to restore the flow of critical minerals when they meet their Chinese counterparts for a new round of trade negotiations Monday in London, a top economic aide to President Donald Trump said.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Lee

media:content.media:description: Various rare earth minerals on display in a showroom at the Baotou Jiangxin Micro Motor Technology Co., in Baotou, Inner Mongolia, China, on Thursday, June 1, 2023. Traditionally a center for coal and steel, the city is marketing itself as the “World’s Green Silicon City,” to lure factories that process the metal needed for semiconductors with low-cost, renewable power.

item.title: Israel Vows to Stop Greta Thunberg’s Ship From Reaching Gaza
item.description: Israel won’t allow a humanitarian aid ship — carrying activists including Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg — to reach Gaza, Defense Minister Israel Katz said on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Alisa Odenheimer

media:content.media:description: Greta Thunberg speaking at the press conference. Greta is part of the crew of the ship Madleen, headed to Gaza to deliver humanitarian aid on June 01, 2025 in Catania, Italy.

item.title: Gaza Militia With Ties to Israel Emerges to Challenge Hamas
item.description: A Palestinian militia operating with tacit approval from Israel has surfaced in the war-ravaged Gaza Strip to challenge the rule of Hamas, which threatened a crackdown in turn.
item.dc:creator: Fares Alghoul, Dan Williams

media:content.media:description: Dislocated Palestinian refugees flee to find safety in Gaza, Palestinian territories on March 20, 2025. (Photo by Youssef Alzanoun / Middle East Images / Middle East Images via AFP) (Photo by YOUSSEF ALZANOUN/Middle East Images/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Ukraine Rejects Claim Russian Forces Enter Key Central Region
item.description: Kyiv’s armed forces rejected as “disinformation” Russia’s claim that its ground troops have crossed into Ukraine’s Dnipropetrovsk region for the first time, even as prospects for a US-brokered ceasefire remain elusive.
item.dc:creator: Kateryna Chursina, Aliaksandr Kudrytski

media:content.media:description: A road sign marking the entrance to the Dnipropetrovsk region.

item.title: Colombia Candidate Fighting for Life After Assassination Bid
item.description: Colombian presidential candidate Miguel Uribe Turbay remains in a critical condition after an assassination attempt on Saturday that recalled the political violence that roiled the nation in the 1980s and 1990s.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Laya, Andreina Itriago

media:content.media:description: Miguel Uribe Photographer: Sebastian Barros/NurPhoto/Getty Images

item.title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree to De-Escalate Border Standoff
item.description: The governments of Thailand and Cambodia agreed to de-escalate a border standoff by adjusting military forces in the conflict zone, following a skirmish in late May. The decision was announced by Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra in a post on X late Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Pathom Sangwongwanich

media:content.media:description: A Thai soldier stands guard at the disputed ancient Khmer temple Prasat Ta Muen Thom, or Prasat Ta Moan Thom in Khmer, on the Cambodian-Thai border in Oddar Meanchey province on March 26, 2025. (Photo by TANG CHHIN Sothy / AFP) (Photo by TANG CHHIN SOTHY/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Trump to Send 2,000 National Guard Troops to Calm LA Unrest
item.description: President Donald Trump will send the National Guard to restore order in Los Angeles in response to growing unrest over a wave of federal immigration raids.
item.dc:creator: Alicia A. Caldwell, Sarah McGregor, Janine Phakdeetham

media:content.media:description: Police fire tear gas during protests against ICE and immigration raids in Paramount, California, on June 7. Photographer: Myung J. Chun/Los Angeles Times/Getty Images

item.title: Westinghouse In Talks for Role in US Nuclear Expansion Plan: FT
item.description: Westinghouse Electric Co. is in discussions with US officials to deploy 10 large nuclear reactors, as it seeks a role in fulfilling President Donald Trump’s ambitions to bolster America’s nuclear energy capabilities, the Financial Times reported.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Meley

media:content.media:description: A handout illustration shows Westinghouse Electric Co.'s AP 1000 Reactor.

item.title: Macron Says Subsidy for Energy Efficient Homes Should Go On
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron called on his government to continue a home renovation subsidy program after the finance ministry said it would temporarily halt the grants.
item.dc:creator: Ania Nussbaum

media:content.media:description: Emmanuel Macron

item.title: US Trade Team Said to Extend India Stay as Talks Gather Momentum
item.description: A US trade team that’s currently in India for negotiations has extended its stay, according to people familiar with the matter, in a sign talks are progressing ahead of a July deadline.
item.dc:creator: Shruti Srivastava

media:content.media:description: A container ship docked at the Mundra Port of Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd. in Mundra, Gujarat, India, on Saturday, May 18, 2024. With a total market capitalization of $213 billion across 10 listed units alone, Adani Group controls vast swathes of the infrastructure that powers the nation’s growth and underpins the Asian expansion of companies from Apple Inc. to Amazon.com Inc. Photographer: Sumit Dayal/Bloomberg

item.title: Chad to Suspend Visas for US Citizens After Trump Travel Ban
item.description: N'DJAMENA, Chad (AP) — Chad's President Mahamat Idriss Deby has announced that his country will suspend the issuing of visas to U.S. citizens in response to the Trump administration’s decision to ban Chadians from visiting the United States.

media:content.media:description: Mahamat Idriss Deby

item.title: Italy Votes on Citizenship, Job Protections Amid Turnout Concern
item.description: ROME (AP) — Italians vote over two days starting Sunday on referendums that would make it easier for children born in Italy to foreigners to obtain citizenship, and on providing more job protections. But apparent low public awareness risks rendering the vote invalid if turnout is not high enough.

media:content.media:description: Campaign posters calling for a vote in a referendum in downtown Rome.

item.title: UK Vows Due Diligence on China Embassy Amid Security Concerns
item.description: The UK government promised to assess any security concerns related to the construction of a Chinese embassy near the City of London, an issue that could potentially complicate trade talks with the US.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Meley

media:content.media:description: The Royal Mint Court office complex, the possible future site of a new Chinese Embassy i in London, UK, on Friday, Feb. 14, 2025. British intelligence services have raised concerns that the placement of the new embassy at Royal Mint Court could grant China access to sensitive communication cables running beneath the City’s business district

item.title: Labour’s Big Worry Is No One Will Feel Record Spending Surge
item.description: Britain’s Labour government will make an historic investment into the country’s battered public services this week — a £300 billion ($406 billion) uplift for areas such as health care, education and transport, amounting to the largest sustained funding increase since at least 2010.
item.dc:creator: Philip Aldrick

item.title: Tusk’s Authority Takes a Hit From Nationalist Win Before Polish Confidence Vote
item.description: Donald Tusk’s premiership is reeling from a presidential election debacle that’s left the Polish leader diminished in the face of a resurgent nationalist opposition.
item.dc:creator: Agnieszka Barteczko, Natalia Ojewska

media:content.media:description: Donald Tusk Photographer: Atdhe Mulla/Bloomberg

item.title: UK Timeline for US Deal Is Too Ambitious, Ex-Trade Adviser Says
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer would need President Donald Trump to be “extraordinarily generous” to meet his ambition of finalizing the UK-US tariff deal in two weeks, according to Britain’s former top trade negotiator.
item.dc:creator: Lucy White, Jack Ryan

item.title: The Wall Street Billionaire Who Transformed Himself Into a MAGA Memelord
item.description: Investor Bill Ackman became a very-online, Trump-loving culture warrior. Now he wants to be the next Warren Buffett.
item.dc:creator: Annie Massa, Katherine Burton

item.title: Trump Warns Musk Not to Back Democrats as Vance Aims for Detente
item.description: President Donald Trump said Elon Musk will pay “very serious consequences” if the billionaire tech mogul funds Democratic candidates that challenge lawmakers who backed Republicans’ tax-and-spending bill.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Lee

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump, right, and Elon Musk, ceo of Tesla Inc., during a news conference in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, DC, on May 30.

item.title: Reeves to Announce £86 Billion for Science and Technology in Spending Review
item.description: Research into drug treatments and longer-lasting batteries will receive new funding as part of an £86 billion package for science and technology set to be announced in next week's spending review.

media:content.media:description: Rachel Reeves Photographer: Andy Rain/EPA

item.title: Milei’s Crypto Promoting Not Improper, Corruption Office Says
item.description: Argentina President Javier Milei didn’t act improperly when he promoted a crypto token called Libra in February, according to a decision by a government anti-corruption office.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Gilbert

media:content.media:description: Javier Milei

item.title: Trump Denies Making Decision to Return Abrego Garcia to US
item.description: President Donald Trump said he wasn’t involved in the decision to bring back Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man his administration mistakenly deported to a prison in El Salvador, and suggested federal prosecutors should have an easy case.
item.dc:creator: Maria Paula Mijares Torres

media:content.media:description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia Photographer: Murray Osorio PLLC/AP Photo

item.title: Yusuf Returns to Reform UK Just 48 Hours After Quitting as Chair
item.description: Zia Yusuf is returning to Reform UK just 48 hours after quitting as party chairman, claiming his resignation was a "mistake".

media:content.media:description: Zia Yusuf

item.title: Iran Claims Access to Cache of Sensitive Israeli Nuclear Files
item.description: Iran’s state television said on Saturday the country obtained a large trove of sensitive Israeli nuclear information.
item.dc:creator: Arsalan Shahla

media:content.media:description: The Negev Nuclear Research Center near the city of Dimona, Israel Planet Labs Inc.

item.title: Brazil Lawmakers Gear Up for Fight Over Corporate Tax Exemptions
item.description: Scaling back corporate tax exemptions in Brazil will be top of the agenda for lawmakers when they meet with the government on Sunday night, House Speaker Hugo Motta said.
item.dc:creator: Felipe Saturnino, Giovanna Bellotti Azevedo

media:content.media:description: Hugo Motta, Brazil's speaker of the lower house.

item.title: Russia, Ukraine Wrangle Over Delay to Planned Prisoner Swap
item.description: Russia and Ukraine wrangled over details of a large prisoner swap, with officials in Kyiv rejecting claims by a Russian negotiator that they were dragging their feet on the planned exchange.
item.dc:creator: Greg Sullivan

media:content.media:description: Relatives and military personnel welcome Ukrainian servicemen following a major prisoner of war (POW) swap with Russia at an undisclosed location in Ukraine, on Friday, May 23, 2025. Ukraine’s capital was targeted by a Russian drone and missile barrage overnight, hours after the warring sides started a large prisoner swap that’s due to continue over the weekend. Photographer: Andrew Kravchenko/Bloomberg

item.title: China Approves Some Exports of Rare Earths Ahead of US Talks
item.description: Beijing says it granted approval to some applications for the export of rare earths, a move that could ease tensions before trade negotiations between the US and China next week.
item.dc:creator: Felix Tam

media:content.media:description: A rare earth mine in Baotou, Inner Mongolia, China.

item.title: Trump’s China Gambit Belies Rocky Road Ahead on Tariff Deals
item.description: President Donald Trump has come up short on striking trade deals with most nations with just one month left before his self-imposed tariff deadline, even as he took his first steps in weeks toward engaging with China.
item.dc:creator: Josh Wingrove

media:content.media:description: Chinese President Xi Jinping (facing camera) and his U.S. counterpart Donald Trump are pictured before a photo session at a Group of 20 summit in Buenos Aires on Nov. 30, 2018. (Kyodo) ==Kyodo (Photo by Kyodo News Stills via Getty Images)

item.title: Vance Says He Hopes Musk Returns to Fold After Public Feud With Trump
item.description: Vice President JD Vance said Elon Musk is making a “huge mistake” in going after Donald Trump and expressed hopes the billionaire will come back into the fold following the public feud that unfolded.
item.dc:creator: Kate Sullivan

media:content.media:description: JD Vance

item.title: Thousands Gather for Anti-Austerity Demonstration in London
item.description: Thousands of people have gathered to "send a message" to the Government with a demonstration over spending cuts and welfare reform.

media:content.media:description: People attending the People's Assembly Against Austerity protest in central London. Picture date: Saturday June 7, 2025. PA Photo. See PA story POLITICS Protest. Photo credit should read: Lucy North/PA Wire
